questions.question: A running route is 42.2 km long and a runner took 4 hours 45 minutes to finish the route. Calculate the speed of the runner in metres per second.
(a) Simplify 1/(124/6256g)f.
(b) 15^9 - 15^81k = 0. Find the value of k.
questions.question_type: Factorising an algebraic expression by extracting common factors

questions.question: Given that sin θ = 0.8211, find the two possible values of θ, where 0° ≤ θ ≤ 180°.
(a) Prove that A = 27 × 511 × 78 is divisible by 245.
questions.question_type: Finding the prime factors of a composite number

questions.question: (b) The number A × k is a perfect square. Find the smallest possible integer value of k.
questions.question_type: Solving a problem involving a perfect square

questions.question: (c) The number B = 25 × 36 × 73. Find the highest common factor (HCF) and lowest common multiple (LCM) of A and B as a product of its prime factors.
questions.question_type: Finding the highest common factor of 2 numbers

questions.question: Zen invests $42000 at a rate of 1.6% per annum compounded monthly. Calculate the value of the investment at the end of 3 years.
(a) Express x^2 + 6x + 10 in the form of (x + h)^2 + k.
questions.question_type: Using algebraic identities to evaluate a perfect square

questions.question: (b)(i) Using your answer in (a), write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the curve y = x^2 + 6x + 10.
(b)(ii) Explain why the equation x^2 + 6x + 10 = 0 does not have any solutions.
questions.question_type: Solving quadratic equations by quadratic formula

questions.question: Paul is 25% heavier than Mike. Mike is 25% lighter than Oscar. Find the ratio of the weight of Paul to that of Oscar.
Rachel bought 8 watches for $900 each. She sold 4 watches at a profit of 80%, and 3 watches at a loss of 50%. She kept one watch for herself. Calculate Rachel’s net profit.
A company produces light bulbs. The lifespan, in hours, of 240 light bulbs is tested. The cumulative frequency curve shows the distribution of lifespan of the light bulbs.
Use the diagram to estimate the median lifespan of the light bulbs.
Use the diagram to estimate the interquartile range of the lifespan of the light bulbs.
Light bulbs with a lifespan of over x hours can be sold. Only 80 of the light bulbs tested meet this requirement. Find the value of x.
The diagram, which is not drawn to scale, shows the three lines. Show that k = 1.
questions.question_type: Finding the gradient of a line

questions.question: Find the coordinates of point D.
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form 79/(33yy) + (yy) - .
Factorise completely. 33x^2y + 11xy.
questions.question_type: Factorising an algebraic expression by extracting common factors

questions.question: Factorise completely. x^3 + x^2 – 9x – 9.
questions.question_type: Factorising an algebraic expression by grouping

questions.question: Expand and simplify ( x + 3y) (4x – 3y).
questions.question_type: Finding the product of 2 algebraic expressions

questions.question: A bag contains blue, green and red marbles. There are 3 more green marbles than blue marbles. Half of the marbles in the bag are red. Given that the probability of choosing a blue marble is 6/25, find the number of green marbles in the bag.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability of single events

questions.question: Show that 23(3x - 10) + 2(x - 10) - 8x is divisible by 5 for any integer x.

The diagram shows one interior angle of each of the three polygons, A, B and C. The polygons fit together at the point O. The interior angle of polygon A is 90°. The interior angle of polygon B is 130°. Explain why polygon C can be a regular polygon.
questions.question_type: Finding the interior and exterior angles of a regular polygon

questions.question: The graph shows the average performance score of two companies from year 2011 to 2015. State one aspect of the graphs which may be misleading and explain how this may lead to a misinterpretation.
On the Venn diagram, shade the region that represents 'PQ∪'.
questions.question_type: Shading Venn diagrams, given the set notations

questions.question: It is given that {x : x is an integer and 10 ≤ 3x + 5 < 40}, A = {x : x is divisible by 4} and B = {x : x is a prime number}. (i) List the elements in A.
questions.question_type: Listing the elements of a set

questions.question: Use one of the symbols below to complete each statement. A …… B
Sketch the graph of y = 2x^2 + 3x - 8 on the axes below. Indicate clearly the points where the graph crosses the axes and its turning point.
Simplify 22 226 7 5 18 50x xy y xy−−−.
y is proportional to the square root of x. If the value of x is increased by 300%, the value of y will be increased by r %. Find the value r.
questions.question_type: Finding an equation when y is directly proportional to square root of x

questions.question: A concert was held over a particular weekend. The matrix M shows the number of tickets sold on Saturday and Sunday respectively. (a) The concert tickets were priced at $6 for a child, $15 for an adult and $8 for a senior citizen. Represent this information in a 1 × 3 matrix P.
Evaluate the matrix T = PM.
State what each of the elements in matrix T represents.
The elements of the matrix N, where N = QM, represents the number of tickets sold on each day of the concert. Write down the matrix Q.

The diagram shows a figure made up of four identical rectangles. The length of the rectangle is 7 cm longer than the breadth of the rectangle. The perimeter of this figure is 138 cm. Find the area of this figure.
In the diagram, 𝑂𝐴𝐵 and 𝑂𝑀𝑁 are sectors of two concentric circles with the same centre at 𝑂. 𝑂𝐴=𝑂𝐵=15 cm and angle 𝐴𝑂𝐵 =2 radians. The area of the shaded region is 136 cm². Find the length of AM.
The diagram shows a park PQRS and a path PR. S is due north of P and the bearing of R from P is 018°. It is also given that PQ = 72 m, QR = 45 m, RS = 28 m and PR = 90 m. (a) Calculate (i) angle PSR.

The diagram shows a park PQRS and a path PR. S is due north of P and the bearing of R from P is 018°. It is also given that PQ = 72 m, QR = 45 m, RS = 28 m and PR = 90 m. (a) Calculate (ii) the bearing of P from R.
Show that angle PQR is 97.903°, correct to three decimal places.
Find (i) area of triangle PQR.
Find (ii) the shortest distance from Q to PR.
A lamp post stands vertically at point Q. The greatest angle of elevation of the top of the lamp post when viewed from a point along PR is 8°. Calculate the height of the lamp post.
questions.question_type: Finding an unknown side in a right-angled triangle

questions.question: OWXY is a parallelogram. P is a point on WX such that 3/5 WP = WX. 54ab = YX + and 10 5ab = OY - . (a) Find YP in terms of a and b.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors

questions.question: Q is on OY produced such that OY : YQ is 5 : 2. Show that QX and YP are equal vectors.
Find the value of area of triangle PXY / area of triangle OPY.
